channel.title: Thank You! But I'm Not Pregnant...Just Fat!
channel.description: A frank humor-filled podcast about the life of a plus-size college student. Miss Fattie covers real issues like clothes, exercise, diets, sex and society's perception of the full figure gal.
channel.itunes:subtitle: A former size 6 discovers her size 20 self
channel.itunes:author: Ms. Fattie
channel.itunes:summary: A frank humor-filled podcast about the life of a plus-size college student. Miss Fattie covers real issues like clothes, exercise, diets, sex and society's perception of the full figure gal.

item.title: Five Months and Fifteen Pounds: Welcome back to Miss Fattie
item.description: Miss Fattie is back with a vengeance. This episode is jam-packed with topics to stir your inner Miss Fattie self. The Topic of The Week is relationships, and she's going to tell it like it is. She also addresses all the current events surrounding weight. Visit Miss Fattie at her MySpace: www.myspace.com/thankyoubut.
item.dc:creator: Ms. Fattie

item.title: 'Tis the Season for a Fattie comeback!
item.description: It's been a while! The Christmas season has Miss Fattie in a giving mood, and she's giving advice on Christmas shopping for our oversized friends and family. Miss Fattie also updates us on her extended absence, and why wedding dress shopping is comparable to high school self-esteem. Visit Miss Fattie on MySpace at www.myspace.com/thankyoubut. You can add Miss Fattie as a friend, send a comment or message, read background on each episode as well as see a list of featured artists for this episode.
item.dc:creator: Ms. Fattie
item.itunes:summary:
It's been a while! The Christmas season has Miss Fattie in a giving mood, and she's giving advice on Christmas shopping for our oversized friends and family. Miss Fattie also updates us on her extended absence, and why wedding dress shopping is comparable to high school self-esteem.
Visit Miss Fattie on MySpace at www.myspace.com/thankyoubut. You can add Miss Fattie as a friend, send a comment or message, read background on each episode as well as see a list of featured artists for this episode.

item.title: Friendships and Fat; Can’t we all just get along?
item.description: Our third episode has Miss Fattie reviewing friendships and weight. Do we make friends because of weight? Can weight drive friends apart? Miss Fattie takes a scholarly view of the issue but interjects her personal experiences. How can you build a solid relationship on fattie issues? Plus, the weekly status report tackles proactive diet and exercise versus being happy the way you are. Visit Miss Fattie on MySpace at www.myspace.com/thankyoubut. You can add Miss Fattie as a friend, send a comment or message, read background on each episode as well as see a list of featured artists for this episode.

item.title: Full-Figured and Sexy and no, that’s not an oxymoron
item.description: This week Miss Fattie explores the unknown...full-figured sex. It's hard to enjoy sex when society tells people of size, it's shameful or funny. Miss Fattie is going to take a practical approach to sex. She'll give advice about feeling and looking sexy as well as preferred positions for the plus-sized crowd. Also, she'll give a weekly status report on her progress with the battle of the bulge. Visit Miss Fattie on MySpace at www.myspace.com/thankyoubut. You can add Miss Fattie as a friend, send a comment or message, read background on each episode as well as see a list of featured artists for this episode.

item.title: Introducing....Miss Fattie!
item.description: In the first episode, Miss Fattie sets the stage for a very frank take on girls of size. We learn about the life of Miss Fattie and how she got that way (hint...it involves 2 arches). Miss Fattie also tackles the clothing industry and reality TV.
